item.title: Texas Chain Saw Massacre Teases New Killer Debut
item.description:
Highlights

  • Hands, the new Killer in Texas Chain Saw Massacre, is a mysterious biker set to debut June 11.
  • Updates to the game include a ban for leaving matches to prevent lobby-dodging, as well as stormy map variants and new perks.
  • Players can now unlock Blackout cosmetic items at level 99, as a thank you from Texas Chain Saw Massacre to its community.

The Texas Chain Saw Massacre has teased its next Killer, Hands, who appears to be an original character that takes on the appearance of an evil biker. The new Texas Chain Saw Massacre addition is set to release on June 11.

Texas Chain Saw Masscare is still receiving semi-regular updates, with a recent one making significant changes to Texas Chain Saw 's lobby system . Now, players receive a three-minute ban for voluntarily leaving a match in an effort to fix lobby-dodging issues. While non-gameplay improvements like that one are always welcome, Texas Chain Saw Massacre fans won't have to wait long until they see new in-game features as well.

Related
The Texas Chain Saw Massacre Game Is Swapping Developers

The Texas Chain Saw Massacre game confirms it will soon be swapping developers in a surprise announcement that befuddled the fandom.

Publisher Gun Interactive's official YouTube account posted a short video that teased the new Hands Killer coming on June 11. Hands is mostly covered in shadow in the video, but he appears to take on the appearance of an evil biker by donning a leather jacket, blue jeans, long hair, and a hammer. Hands appears to be another original creation instead of being inspired by one of the Texas Chain Saw Massacre movies; however, the video does not hint much at what abilities Hands might come with. His hammer and physical strength will probably play a role in his attributes, but other than that info, fans will need to wait until Texas Chain Saw Massacre fully unveils its newest Killer.

Texas Chain Saw Massacre New Killer Teaser Video

The Texas Chain Saw Massacre has released other new content recently, like a May 14 update that added a nighttime variant to the Nancy's House map. The variant, which introduces a stormy setting to the level, is apparently only the first of its kind, as developers explained that all maps will receive storm variants in the future. This was preceded by an April 30 update that introduced a bunch of changes to perks, characters, and various gameplay mechanics.

It's not clear whether Hands' arrival next month will be accompanied by other gameplay improvements. However, it certainly seems possible seeing that Virginia's introduction in March came as part of a larger update that balanced various characters. If this is the case again, players will need to wait a bit longer until the developers reveal any of the balance or gameplay changes coming on June 11.

Recently, Texas Chain Saw added free content for its most dedicated players as a show of thanks to the game's community. Those who reach level 99 can now unlock the all-black Blackout cosmetic items for both Family and Victim characters.

item.title: Splatoon 3 Splatfest Results Break a Long-Running Trend
item.description:
Highlights

  • Team Bucket List, led by Frye, won the May 2024 Splatfest in Splatoon 3 by a narrow margin, ending Frye's long losing streak.
  • The revamped point system in Patch 7.0.0 allowed for a close battle, with second-place teams now earning points to decrease the gap.
  • Splatfests are a great way for players to earn rewards by supporting their chosen team based on different themes each month.

The May 2024 "World's End" Splatfest of Splatoon 3 concluded on May 19, and Team Bucket List, backed by Frye of Deep Cut, emerged victorious by a narrow margin over Shiver's Team Same Ol'. The win for Frye broke a long losing streak in Splatoon 3 , which lasted over a year, and the new point system introduced in Patch 7.0.0 made the Splatfest a close battle.

Held approximately once every month, the Splatfests in Splatoon 3 are a lucrative way for players to earn currency and rewards for supporting the team that wins first place. Each Splatfest has a different theme, with each member of Deep Cut supporting one side of the theme. While the first two Splatoon games saw two teams face off, Splatoon 3 made it a three-team battle in each Splatfest. With the May 2024 Splatfest , the theme took a dark undertone, as "What would you do at the world's end?" was the question posed to players globally. Team Same Ol' was backed by Shiver, Frye was picked for Team Bucket List, and Big Man supported Team Save the World.

2:19
Related
June 1 is Going to Be a Big Day for Splatoon 3

Splatoon 3 fans should mark June 1 in their calendars, as Nintendo reveals that the popular third-person shooter game will receive a major update.

Team Bucket List had a halftime Clout lead of 34.06%, with Same Ol' and Save the Day checking in at 33.36% and 32.58% each. For the first time since the Spicy vs Sweet vs Sour Splatfest of January 2023, Frye's team took first place in the Splatfest. This broke a losing streak that lasted over a year and a half and saw Big Man's streak of winning the two recent Splatfests in Splatoon 3 end. Team Same Ol' took first place in Conch Shells and Clout (Pro), which earned them 210 points. However, Team Bucket List pulled ahead with points in Votes, Clout (Open), and the open Tricolor Turf War, which gave them 370 of their 415 points.

Splatoon 3 May 2024 Splatfest Results (What Would You Do At The World's End?)

  • Team Bucket List (Frye): 415p
  • Team Same Ol' (Shiver): 395p
  • Team Save the World (Big Man): 60p

A change to Splatfest points was made during Splatoon 3 Patch 7.0.0 , which increased the point totals and awarded points to the second-place team in each category. The second-place points are worth half the value of first place, which can allow teams to close the gap. This allowed Team Save the World to grab 60 points thanks to a second-place result in Clout (Pro). Twitter user OatmealDome pointed out that Frye would have won under the old point system. In that case, the score would have been 38 points for Frye, 19 points for Shiver, and no points for Big Man.

With Splatoon 3 continuing to receive periodic updates , support for the game remains at a strong point. It remains to be seen what the next Splatfest theme will be.

item.title: Black Myth: Wukong Locks Down August Release Date
item.description:
Highlights

  • Black Myth: Wukong, inspired by Journey to the West, features stunning Unreal Engine 5 graphics and challenging Soulslike combat.
  • Players embody a monkey-like warrior with mystical powers, martial arts, and the ability to transform in combat.
  • Developed by Game Science, this visually rich RPG offers a fresh take on Chinese mythology, launching on August 20.

The long-in-development Black Myth: Wukong has shown off another trailer, one that cements its previously reported August release date. Way back in 2020, Chinese developer Game Science released a 13-minute pre-alpha gameplay video for what would become Black Myth: Wukong , an action RPG inspired by the classic 16th-century Chinese epic, Journey to the West . Over the years, even more of the game was revealed in trailers, highlighting Black Myth ’s impressive Unreal Engine 5 graphics and blistering Soulslike combat.

Black Myth: Wukong puts players in the role of a monkey-like warrior inspired by Sun Wukong, the Monkey King of Chinese folklore. This unlikely hero will travel the land, battling frightening monsters using a trusty bo staff, mystical powers, and fluid martial arts. Black Myth 's Son Wukong-inspired protagonist can also transform into insects and other creatures to help in combat or reach otherwise inaccessible parts of the open world. This promising gameplay was most recently shown at The Game Awards 2023 back in December, where Black Myth ’s release date was officially announced as August 20, 2024.

Related
Black Myth: Wukong Might Give FromSoftware Competition in One Big Area

Black Myth: Wukong, the upcoming Soulslike set in Ancient China, could give FromSoftware a run for its money in one crucial area.

This release date was reinforced in a new Black Myth: Wukong trailer, which was shown at the recent WeGame 2024 showcase. The trailer itself shows more of Black Myth ’s enemy creatures , diverse landscapes, and magic-infused combat, all while the monkey warrior discovers a golden crown seemingly pulled from Journey to the West . In the original tale, Sun Wukong wore this crown as a punishment for killing six thieves after being freed from his five hundred-year-long imprisonment, but it isn’t clear what purpose the headband serves in Black Myth: Wukong ’s take on the novel’s story.

Black Myth: Wukong Release Date

  • August 20, 2024

Before Black Myth: Wukong , developer Game Science found success with mobile games like 100 Heroes and Red Tides . Black Myth marks the studio’s first console release, and it has already drawn up interest from fans of From Software’s Soulslike games and Dragon Ball – especially since the latter was inspired by Journey to the West just like Black Myth . Many also see Black Myth as a potential entry point into Chinese mythology alongside other recent Eastern-themed titles like Faith of Danschant: Hereafter .

Black Myth: Wukong already looks like an exciting and visually rich experience for the first console effort from a studio known mostly for mobile releases, with its 4K-rendered landscapes and horrific monster designs . Players won’t have to wait too much longer to challenge these fearsome beasts as the Destined One, as Black Myth: Wukong is set to launch on PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and Windows PCs on August 20.

item.title: Awesome Art of Elden Ring's Maliketh Gives Serious Berserk Vibes
item.description:
An Elden Ring player shared a piece of Maliketh fan art that looked as if it were a sketch from Berserk mangaka Kentaro Miura. Elden Ring creator Hidetaka Miyazaki has repeatedly showcased his fascination for other series in his works, with the FromSoftware director even hiding multiple references to Berserk throughout his various games. Miura's beloved manga series and Miyazaki's personal love for dark fantasy have since inspired many artists, who have fallen in love with the grim yet beautiful aesthetics unique to both creators and sought to blend both franchises in tribute.

Since its release in 2022, Elden Ring has cemented itself as one of the landmark titles in the modern video game industry, with fans and critics alike praising its vast open world, evolution of the Soulslike gameplay formula, and stellar art style. As with many popular works, Elden Ring 's widespread success led to a massive audience from around the world, who have continued to keep the game alive with fanmade content even two years after its debut. Now, with the impending release of the Shadows of the Erdtree DLC expansion, a flood of creative users are once again delving into the Lands Between for inspiration.

Related
Elden Ring Player Finds Hilarious Loophole for Great Jar Challenge

An Elden Ring player figures out how to cheese the three Knights in the Great-Jar Challenge with an exceedingly simple tactic.

One such user posted a Berserk -inspired Elden Ring piece for Maliketh, the Black Blade. Reddit user Prsy______ shared their pen art of the legendary boss on the Elden Ring subreddit, with the illustration showcasing Maliketh howling while wielding his iconic sword. The artwork was received with overwhelming praise by other users, who praised the piece for its detail and stark imagery of black and red on white. Several commenters additionally drew comparisons to Berserk , with one fan even stating that it wouldn't look out of place on a cover for the beloved manga series.

Elden Ring Player Shares Berserk-Style Fan Art

Fans looking for more Berserk -style fan art for Elden Ring might also be interested in Prsy______'s previous works. The artist has posted similar pen art for a variety of characters from the Lands Between, with pieces centering on several fan-favorites like Miquella and Blaidd. They've also shared illustrations for other iconic FromSoftware games and franchises, such as Dark Souls , Bloodborne , and Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice .

Berserk 's influence on Miyazaki and FromSoftware video games as a whole has always been a source of fascination for fans of both video games and manga. Not only does it provide a glimpse into how art influences subsequent works, but it also provides commonality between Elden Ring developers and players alike, who were all left awestruck by the gritty yet fantastical world portrayed in Miura's beloved manga series.

item.title: Rumor: Resident Evil Remake Leak Reveals Gameplay and Launch Platform Details
item.description:
Highlights

  • An insider hints at a modern remake of the original Resident Evil game, potentially featuring significant changes and additions.
  • Rumored changes include ditching the fixed camera.
  • Remake may blend original game elements with modern technology, hinting at a more immersive and intense gaming experience.

A YouTuber has disclosed potential details surrounding a new remake of the first Resident Evil game. Rumors of a Resident Evil remake have been gaining traction in the past week.

Released in 1996, the original Resident Evil established Capcom as a pioneer in the survival-horror genre of video games. Six years after its initial launch, the game was remade exclusively for the Nintendo GameCube, with an HD remaster being released across more platforms in 2015. The remaster bumped up the resolution and aspect ratio, but its slow pacing and control scheme, while instrumental in building a tense atmosphere, can feel outdated for some, leading to calls for a ground-up modern remake. With Capcom greenlighting more Resident Evil remakes last year, many wondered if the very first game would be a part of them.

Related
Rumor: Resident Evil 9 Setting Leaked

A reputable Capcom insider spills the beans on Resident Evil 9's setting, which potentially mirrors one of the series' best.

Film industry insider DanielRPK recently claimed that a Resident Evil 1 remake is underway at Capcom , with the game set to receive the same modern revival that the second, third, and fourth games in the series have been subject to. Seemingly adding to this rumor, Resident Evil YouTuber Biohazard Declassified claims to have received inside information outlining significant changes and additions to the highly anticipated remake, which will allegedly be dubbed Biohazard: RE1 in Japan. The leak asserts that the remake will retain the slower-paced gameplay of the original, with another notorious retention.

The Remake Might Ditch the Original's Fixed Camera

Crimson Heads, a type of mutated, more dangerous zombie, are also rumored to return. They were famously difficult to kill in the original, and what could make them even tougher to take on in the remake is the alleged choice for enemies to be "bullet sponges," which means they'll require more bullets to kill. Another significant departure from the original is a rumored third-person over-the-shoulder camera, much like Resident Evil 4 's remake. Furthermore, the original game's pre-rendered backgrounds may be replaced with real-time environments rendered in the RE Engine, with no loading screens.

The leak also claims that the remake will reportedly ditch previous-gen hardware entirely and target current-gen consoles like the PS5 and Xbox Series X/S. With that said, the leak is obviously unconfirmed, but does contain plausible ideas for how Capcom would approach a Resident Evil 1 remake - blending the most memorable aspects of the original with cutting-edge modern sensibilities. It remains to be seen when this remake will be announced, with Capcom speculated to be saving it for the series' 30th anniversary in 2026.
